etymologies: late Middle English (in the general sense ‘substitution’): from late Latin subrogatio(n-), from subrogare ‘choose as substitute’, from sub- ‘in place of another’ + rogare ‘ask’

definitions: the substitution of one person or group by another in respect of a debt or insurance claim, accompanied by the transfer of any associated rights and duties.
shortDefinitions: substitution of one person or group by another in respect of debt or insurance claim
